Absolutely.
We spend - it's - you know, a lot of people make the mistake and believe that, you know, the Olympics really happens only once every four years, but it really doesn't.
For Olympic athletes and Olympic hopefuls, it's an everyday thing for four years.

We spend, in my event, you know, I spend several hours, three to six hours, every single day for four years training for what really amounts to less than a minute and a half total of competition time.
And if you're not on, on that day, there is no room.
There's no appeals process.
There's no such thing as well, you know, I can get through because of my past performances.
You have to perform on that day.
There's a lot of pressure, a lot of stress, and ultimately that's what the Olympic trials - that's why the Olympic trials are America's hardest team to make.

So, this Olympics, for me, it's about attaining a great performance on the day that matters the most, and I have yet to really do that in the past two Olympics.
